items.text: length and wide outside off. Sticks in the pitch a little as he chucks his hands at this to drive through the off side. Off the toe-end
items.shortText: Mashrafe Mortaza to Guptill, no run

items.text: full and in at middle stump, leans in and clips neatly to deep square's left
items.shortText: Mashrafe Mortaza to Guptill, 2 runs

items.text: oh yeah. That's the Guptill people pay to watch. Offcutter at a length on off, gets the big stride down, hits through the line and dead straight. The Guptill no-look launch over the bowler. What a sight.
items.shortText: Mashrafe Mortaza to Guptill, SIX runs

items.text: length on leg stump, tapped to deep square with the angle
items.shortText: Mashrafe Mortaza to Guptill, 1 run

items.text: length and in at leg stump, flicked to midwicket
items.postText: Brett: "@Jimit hardly need to launch. Absolutley no pressure "
items.shortText: Mashrafe Mortaza to Nicholls, no run

items.text: short of a length and in at leg stump. Rapped on the thigh guard as he looks to flick
items.postText: Brendan J : "Wouldn't a block or bash mentality have more significant portion of runs IN boundaries? Nicholls has 37% in boundaries. Mccullum had 58%. Am I missing something? Nicholls gets those ones and twos.. "
items.shortText: Mashrafe Mortaza to Nicholls, no run

items.text: misses the stumps and puts Mustafizur in danger of missing the series too. Length at middle stump, tapped towards mid-off where Liton is quick on the ball and has a nice bounce on it to pick that up. His throw is wildly over the stumps and headed straight for the bowler's mid-riff as he backs up. Guptill was hurring down there
items.shortText: Mustafizur Rahman to Guptill, 1 run

items.text: length outside off, stabbed to third man's left
items.shortText: Mustafizur Rahman to Nicholls, 2 runs

items.text: slower ball at off stump, blocked into the covers, away from the body
items.shortText: Mustafizur Rahman to Nicholls, no run

items.text: offcutter at a length outside off. Defended down the pitch
items.shortText: Mustafizur Rahman to Nicholls, no run

items.preText: Sakib: "The Bangladeshi openers should take a leaf out of NZ openers on how to approach an innings. The key is not losing wickets in the initial overs to provide the team with a platform to launch later on. "
items.text: length and in at leg stump, clipped to deep square off the back foot
items.postText: Amit Pujara: "Nicholls is good and there seems to be no problem with his singles and doubles. Possibly they just want see off early phase where there's swing. "
items.shortText: Mustafizur Rahman to Nicholls, 1 run

items.text: thick edge between point and wide gully! He's been setting him up for that but Guptill survives. Length ball, a ripping offcutter outside off. First driving ball he's offered and the batsman takes the bait. Not to the pitch of this and the extra bounce doesn't allow him to control this shot
items.postText: nathan: "McCullum is a bash bash not a block bash normally nicholls plays well but today too many dots @brendan j" --- Something something Bash bro
items.shortText: Mustafizur Rahman to Guptill, 1 run

items.text: length outside off, driven on the rise to extra cover
items.shortText: Mashrafe Mortaza to Guptill, no run

items.text: length outside off, dropped into the off side with soft hands
items.postText: Wilfred Hickens: "First time NZ has had an opening partnership over 35 in over ten ODI innings... Nicholls must be doing something right."
items.shortText: Mashrafe Mortaza to Guptill, 1 run

items.text: length outside off, driven on the up, point leaps to his left to stop
items.postText: Brett: "Everyone is missing the point. There is no scoreboard pressure. Guppy is feeling it out, coming back from injury and a few scores. Nichols is trying to cement his spot. NZ arnt trying out a new game plan, they have 300 balls to score 233. That's it. Batting first would have seen more risks"
items.shortText: Mashrafe Mortaza to Nicholls, no run

items.text: length and in at middle stump. Tapped towards mid-on
items.shortText: Mashrafe Mortaza to Nicholls, no run

items.text: length on middle stump, allows it to come on and clips to deep square's right with the angle
items.shortText: Mashrafe Mortaza to Nicholls, 1 run

items.text: length and just outside off. Back foot punch past bowler and mid-off. Long-on cleans up
items.postText: Imam: "It's tenth over and Bangladesh are already out of wicket taking options. Mehidy's role has always been to keep one end tigh. With Mashrafe and Mustafiz bowling out their initial spells, whom is BD going to go for wicket? Mahmudullah and Soumya? " --- Mahmudullah has broken a fair share of partnerships...
items.shortText: Mashrafe Mortaza to Guptill, 1 run

items.text: short of a length on off stump, defended to point off the back foot
items.shortText: Mustafizur Rahman to Guptill, no run

items.text: short of a length just outside off, jammed into the pitch as he's hurried on the back foot punch
items.shortText: Mustafizur Rahman to Guptill, 1 run

items.text: offcutter at a length on off stump, looks to flick, inside edge onto thigh
items.shortText: Mustafizur Rahman to Nicholls, no run

items.text: short and wide outside off, swish and miss
items.shortText: Mustafizur Rahman to Nicholls, no run

items.text: length outside off, nicely timed square drive, straight to backward point
items.shortText: Mustafizur Rahman to Nicholls, no run

items.text: short of a length offcutter in the corridor. Digs it into the turf with a back foot punch
items.shortText: Mustafizur Rahman to Nicholls, no run

items.text: inside edge trickles past the stumps. Looking for a big drive through the off side again at a length ball. Too early on it again
items.shortText: Mashrafe Mortaza to Guptill, 1 run
